dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it serious?
An awkward beat. Elise opts for complete honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Complete honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left... David can feel this in the pit of his stomach now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me that well yet. You're still in the wishful thinking phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is I should.;-Have left him a long time before he left me. It was a ,ain' l relationship. It hurt tb be i-h it every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was:h'ard to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H& knew what buttons., tb push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that him? DtTid paints at pica re of Elise with an attractive man, wound each other. lis'e looks surprised, shocked even, to tY%'e photo on her b okcase. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David... . It's not... It's over between us. Completely over...I want to be clear about that. I'm pretty sure yesterday was the most perfect day I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. David looks at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this Diane Sawyer interview.
It comes out awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. So did that. They look at each other. Then David reaches for his clothes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come? My dress rehearsal's not until nine. David's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid if I let you out of my sight. . .you know...I might never see you again... A smile creeps across his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane Sawyer interviewsDavid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've overcome enormous obstacles in your life and risen to-such heights so quickly... People are fascinated by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only people who haven't spent enough time with ' me to know the 'truth.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GREEN ROOM .-- DAY-
dialogues.text: Elise watches the:nterview on a big monitor. A soundproof window allows her tb see directly into the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a speaker and politician you've been repeatedly compared to JFK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By my campaign manager mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the youngest person ever elected to Congress. Which you celebrated by getting in a bar fight on inauguration night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a childhood friend. So I don't think that counts. And, truthfully, that's how we celebrate things we're I'm from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning bigger now) Let's just say you have a habit of getting into the press for...other uniquely human things as well--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that a euphemism, Diane? She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most politicians...

dialogues.speaker: DIANE SAWYER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: .run aw ay from the embarrassing things they've done Yoti,crack, jokes about them. You embrace, them. Especially since your.;, concession speech thr ee years ago which started as a `sstd-up routine and brought tears to my,eyes by the .,end when you talked about losing Your mother to Lancer and then your older brother,,Pdt, to an overdose, both whei.you:were only ten years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Americans are tired of electing automatons whose every word and move is stage-managed so as not to offend anyone. I think they want somebody who doesn't hide who he is or what he really believes. I guess I'm hoping they want to elect someone who's actually like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I could be very wrong about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised at the number of underwear companies that have approached me to be their spokesman. Diane bursts out laughing. The floor techs are laughing t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so is Elise. She's completely smitten. ON THE TV: Diane turns to the camera, trying to stop laughing.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE SAWYER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, we're out of time. David Norris, announced his candidacy for US Senate yesterday. Thanks for stopping by. It goes to commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stays to speak to Diane for a moment-as we MOVE to find a stagehand'who is shifting the position of one of t big video cameras sed to tape the show. We catch a glimps of his face and see it's Thompson's aide. INT<. Gk 2N- R0014 -- DAY The- "stagehand" moves thecamera so it's blocking the win giving Elise line-of sight to David and Diane. Just. then a man with an-.ABC ID enters the room to speak Elise. (We only see his lower half.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, Congressman Norris asked me to give you a message. We MOVE UP from his ID to REVEAL that the man is another of Thompson's aides.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON AIDE
dialogues.text: He was just called into a meeting that he says is urgent. He says he'll call you later and see you at your show tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Diane say goodbye to each other. He salutes the floor staff, who actually applaud. They love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to David, re: earpiece) They're saying your girlfriend -- can we call her that? Is this one going to last more than a month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call her that. And yes. Definitely. David is looking at a text from Elise as he speaks. It sa "I want to go to bed with you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're saying she's getting a tour of the control room in studio C. Can somebody take Congressman Norris to studio C? Thompson's aide signals David to follow him. David does. They walk through a couple thick doors into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson's aide leads him through a heavy door marked "St C" into a, vestibule and then through another heavy door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A partially-built set in the center of an empty stage. El isn't here. Thompson's aide feigns surprise.

dialogues.speaker: T HOMPSON'S AIDE
dialogues.text: They said she was here... . Hang on. David pulls his blackberry out sees there is no signal. H looks up to see Thompson's aide exit through the stage do It suddenly clicks for David, and he rushes to the door. Yanks on it. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the thick window of the outer door we can see Dav pounding on the window of the inner door. But we can't hear a sound. PULL BACK to REVEAL Thompson's aide removing the"Studio C placard. Beneath is the true designation: "Studio D." PAN to REVEAL three Thompson aides removing a false wall was hiding a bunch of construction equipment and setting "No Entry -- Construction Zone" signs.

dialogues.speaker: FRANTIC HANDHELD
dialogues.text: 1) David across the room tugs on another exit. It's locke 2) David pulls a fire alarm. Nothing. 3) David slams on the door with a two-by-four.

dialogues.speaker: COMPOSED DOLLY SHOTS
dialogues.text: 1) Diane Sawyet talks about the issue of the day as we pu back and show her. co-hosts on the couch. 2) Elise arrives in the lobby of the Manhattan Modern Bal for her company's dress rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: INT STUDIO D, (EARLIER ".STUDIO'.C")
dialogues.text: David sits. His tie..loose now. His jacket off. He glance at his blackberry. the time reads 4:13 pm. He yells in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If people could hear you out there it wouldn't be a very good soundstage, would it? David turns to see Thompson, in the now familiar dark sui and fedora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Free Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about Free Will? David stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we actually tried Free Will before. After taking you from hunting and gathering to the height of the Roman Empire we stepped back to see how you'd do on your own. You gave us the Dark Ages -- for five centuries -- until finally we: decided we should come back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chairman thought maybe we just needed to do a better job of teaching you how to ride the bike before we took the training wheels off again. So we gave you the Renaissance, the Enlightenment, the Scientific Revoluton.:ГЇВїВЅwe spent six hundred years tempering your passions with reason.,then in 1910 we stepped ba ГЇВїВЅc again. Within fifty yearsГЇВїВЅyou brought us World War I, the lepre'ssion, Fascism, the Holocaust ani capped it off by bringingtheentire planet to the brink of destruction in the Cuban Missile Crisis. A decisiOfl was taken atthat point that we' should stop in again before Г‚В±ou did _soittething even we Cduldn't fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You on't have_ Free Will, David, you have the appearance of Free =Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me.'to believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have Free Will over what tie you pick in the morning, or what beverage to order at lunch. But humanity just isn't mature enough to have control over the important things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're in control of the important things then you're incompetent cause when I look around at the world these days it seems pretty fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still here. If we'd left things in your hands, it wouldn't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you trying to keep me from Elise? Or are you just another lackey who doesn't really know? Thompson studies David for a long beat. Then decides it's time to level with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We put Elise in front of you three years ago to inspire you to, .g `ve that speech -- the speech that pulled you back from the brink of oblivion and, overnight, itiade.you the front runner for this coming election. The intervention on Charlie was to prevent the hedge fund you had just become vice chairman of from going belly up in the sub-prime=crisis, bringing two major banks down. with it, arid in , the process making you unelectable. David blinks. Tries to, process this... : .bAVID Are you s aying you warit me to win this election?

dialogues.speaker: THOMP50N,
dialogues.text: This 'one and six mom, after it. And t'm not just talking about `elections ' for Senate. lowly dawns on David what Thompson is saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can matter, David. Really matter. What you wanted your whole life. What your father wanted when he took you to the Senate gallery when you were ten. What your brother wanted when he made you promise, the day before he overdosed, that you wouldn't be like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Don't tell me this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think you have that yearning to be in front of people. . .and that terrible emptiness when you're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David you are meant to change the world. But that doesn't happen if you stay with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it matter to you who I love? Some skeleton of hers `is so bad I won't get elected? I don't believe that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about her-:..it's about you, what being with her does to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?! I'm better with her than I ever was alone., You just said it. That speech--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The speech... Put it this wad: in small doses, Elise was the cure. But in large doses... When you're enthralledwith someone she ' rubs off on you:.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Just: stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, the president can't be a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking. It's not working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a politician. I spend my life with professional liars. With people who decide what they want and then figure out the story they have to tell to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you refuse to accept what should be completely obvious by now? You've seen what we can do. You can't doubt we are who we say we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who you are. I don't care who's orders you're following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't outrun your fate, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just reset you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know if you could have we wouldn't be standing here having this conversation... Thompson stares back. He's never dealt with such temerity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fight us, we will take everything from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already did once.' And I'm still standing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: always knew you were out there. We all do. It's the one thing we have in common. Whether we call it God or the Devil or Fate we all know you're out there, fucking with us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd still be living in caves if it weren't for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crush our dreams because they don't fit with your Plan. Your Plan that has no space for me falling in love but somehow has room for Tsunamis and cyclones and Darfur and AIDS. Fuck your plan. I reject it. I reject you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing we have in this fucked up world are the choices we make. And there's nothing you can do to me that will get me sign them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me. Or erase me. Or let me go. Thompson stares back at him, dumbfounded. A long silence,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 6:20. If you leave now, you'll make Elise's show. David's eyebrows go up. Huh? Thompson is letting him go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David jumps into a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sits in the back seat, taking everything in, turnin over and over in his head... .'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise and twb of her colleagues "finish a dance piece. Th audience explodes into applause. The house lights come up half way as the stage is readied the next piece,. David is startled to see that the man in aisle seat next to-him is Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a beautiful dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one more piece to all this I haven't told you. I guess I didn't have the heart. If you stay with her, it doesn't just kill your dreams, it kills hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise is about to become one of the most famous dancers in the country... and eventually one of the greatest choreographers in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she stays with you... she ends up teaching dance to eight year-olds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. I thought we already established that. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you look back at all this, David, just remember, we tried to reason with you. Thompson gets up and leaves...just as the lights go down the next dance. David watches him go...then turns around just in time to catch Elise's entrance into the dance -- a graceful jump. When she lands, her ankle cracks, and she falls. The audience gasps. INSERT: a floor board tilted oddly. It goes back to norma FIND THOMPSON: His hand slightly outstretched. THE AUDIENCE instantly knows something is wrong. David ju up and runs down to the.: stage door. A dancer comes from stage and helps Elise off the floor as the show continues

dialogues.speaker: INT BACK STAGE
dialogues.text: .A company staff member is examining Elise's ankle while show goes on. David arrives. Sees Elise's face. Tears streaming down he cheeks. Seeing David...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's broken...my career's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi rushes to the hospital. David holds her. Silentl trying to comfort her. But he can't look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David carries her from the taxi into the emergency room..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sits in a black chair, alone, staring at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise lies on an exam table as -a tech x-rays her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL WAITING ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: David is still staring at the floor. He looks-up to see Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always hear people saying "you yourself for what can't bla M4' hpens fih other people," but in this case, really, you can. David stands up... . and punnhesThompson in `the face. h T ompson is knocked onto his ass. People in the waiting room stare at David. Almost everyon here knows his fade. He looks at them, unable to summon h usual wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you do, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you did the first night you got elected. This is what you did at that college reunion. We give you opportunities people would kill for and you squander them with impulse. It doesn't take a genius to see Elise isn't exactly going to help you with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know why you can't have her? Look in the mirror. Thompson leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More X-rays of Elise's ankle. An orthopedic surgeon enter and examines the images on the computer screen. Elise, her face, still red and tear stained tries to read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad is it? The surgeon turns to her with a classic doctor's detachme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sits alone on a bench. Thompson arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an educated man. You've read the Greek tragedies`. In the end Fate always wins... David looks back at him in steely silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It a sprain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to watch her lose the only thing she's ever cared about? You just got the tiniest taste of what that looks like... The thought makes David ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away. If you truly love her, walk away. She'll hate you for it...but that way she'll be able to let you go quickly. You can give her that at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stands alone. Stares at the floor. Finally confronting the fact that he can't beat the forces arraye against him. Finally ready to make the choice being force upon him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters to find Elise with a huge smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sprain! It's just a sprain! David gives her a tight hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be okay. The doctor said it would heal in' a month. . .maybe even less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to: be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to do an MRI...to assess the ligament. damage but.: -. They break from them hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's; going to be fine. And as incredible of a dancer as you already are, yot're just going to get better and better... DavidV;embraces her again, so she won't see the tears wel in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I have to go make a few calls. His voice cracks. Elise notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just...happy for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David walks down a long corridor away from Elise's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David exits the building. Thompson is waiting by the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing the right thing, David. Not just for her, and the world. . .but for yourself. David looks at him for a beat, then turns and walks away the night. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a TV screen, then PULL BACK to REVEAL the diner.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL NEWS REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: David Norris, who'has spent the last two days campaigning in the tri-lakes area, got some welcome news yesterday when the latest New York Times poll gave him a sixteen point lead over his opponent less than.a month before election dg t. FIND Charlie. He sits` at a booth eating breakfast as he watches TV behind the counter. Charlie glan ces out the window ad we FIND David standing the back of apickup truck speaking to eighty people in th parking lot. `:It's Autumn now. So etthing about his{,speaking style has changed. He's no ima ea or passion te.:Hedoesn't seem to enjoy it as much is he Г‚В°did three years ago. Just then a campaign aide arrives at Charlie's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still love him... Papers? The aide hands Charlie a stack of papers: three local pap the Times, the Journal, and the three big NYC tabloids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

The aide leaves. Charlie glances at the front page of the Times, then reaches for the New York / Region section. As does the front page of the Arts section catches his eye. There is a big photo of Elise, doing an "airborne split," accompanying an article titled "Dance Takes a Quantum Lea Charlie glances through the window at David who is climbi down from the pickup truck to applause from his parking l audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David shakes hands with people in the aftermath of his speech. They really do love him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINER, UPSTATE NEW YORK MORNING
dialogues.text: Charlie reads the New York Times. article. It begins: "Once in a generation a piece is created of such astounding originality and virtuosity that it single-handedly reshapes. the. world of dance."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he makes his way, towards the diner'f-tom the parking shaking handb and allowing his picture to be taken.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: David sits down with Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to show you this because you'd find out eventually and because I want to be here when you do. Charlie turns the Arts section around for David to see it Elise's photo has a noticeable impact on David. He glance at the article for a moment. Then Charlie points down near the bottom, at a particular
"The show's choreographer, Adrian Troussant, and lead dancer, Elise Sellas, are partners on and off stage and plan to marry in New York next week." David stares at the words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David? (off no response) David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I need... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a day off. Take a couple. We're sixteen points up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even I can't blow a lead that big.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RED HOOK, BROOKLYN NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's pouring rain. David walks down Carroll Street. Most the row houses display "Norris for Senate" signs. Most of the housing here is run-down but this block is clearly in the early'stages of gentrification. David pays particular attention to one row house as he pa by. Was this his house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a "Norris for Senate" sign prominently displayed the window. David enters this classic dive bar and goes t the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still serve neighborhood guys here or just the tourists? The bartender smiles big. A couple people at the bar noti him. Then others notice and they start whooping it up for him. He doesn't know any of them-but they sure know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sits under the huge aluminum roof on one of the pie holding a bottle of beer in a soaked paper bag.
There are no walls to this structure so rainwater pours o the roof on all four sides forming virtual walls. A figure in a suit approaches David from behind. He turns to see the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? REVERSE to REVEAL Harry, in a suit and raincoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have come earlier but I had to wait for the rain. (off David's confusion) Water interferes with their ability to sense your decision tree. That's why we met on a boat last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm here to set the record straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson was lying when he said they couldn't let you be with 8lise because :it would bring out your reckless side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, then? Why do they care so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8ecause.,..she's enough, David. If you have =her r tau rtt .ght not need to fill the d side you with votes and ataplause'and dreams of one day becoming p sident... if Harry has:looked straight into David's soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've watched you a long time. They're right to want you in the White House. It would be good for the world. That's important but it can't be the only thing that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so different than they are?
A long beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your Dad was a smart man. He could have been a lot more -- and he wanted to be. So did your brother. But the Plan didn't call for that. This hits David hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my job, you implement the Plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And most of the time.. .you don't even know why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't me... that wasn't us at all. David takes all this in. After a;long be t he takes a dri Then he offers the bottle to Harry, who h a esitates, the a drink as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Thompson told methe choice as Elise or the White House I barely hesitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the trt t i `is after making that choice I went into a free-fall... Don't get=me wrong, it killed me to see Thompson hurt her...but I used it as an excuse. I think I left her more to save my career than hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson wasn't lying. The press is already talking about me as a future president. I'm phoning in my speeches and I'm still sixteen points up in the polls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The public loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I met Elise that was all that mattered. Now I hardly notice. She's all I think about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where she's getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front of a judge. Tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she happy with him? Tell me she is and I'll walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson won't let you get near that courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry... is she happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. A beat.
